title: The Complete Short Stories of George Moore: Gender and Genre
abstractText: The Anglo-Irish writer George Moore, the 'British Zola' is best known for its contribution to the Irish Literary Revival and Late -Victorian aesthetic debates. This critical edition makes available the collection Celibates, The Untilled Field, A Story-Tellers Holiday, In Single Strictness /Celibate Lives, and other stories. The edition offers detailed contextualisation's, in-depth textual analyses (paying attention to gendered configurations of hysteria, sexual pathology, transgression, and Irish folklore), and reproduces textual variants as well as the contemporary critical response to the text selected, This is the first complete edition, and the first critical edition, of Moore's short fiction to date.
